body.p: Reverend Sir

We address you upon a
subject, the selection of a minister for
the German Congregation of San Francisco
upon which, we desire to elicit your
assistance as the superior advantages
acquired by your position places you
within reach of all the attendant facts of
any importance.

We send you an advertise-
ment for insertion & take the Liberty
of referring to you which you can omit
in the columns of your Occident if you
deem we have no right to intrude upon
your privacy & claim your assistance in
our cause—

Its tone much will inform you
generally of our want but particularly
bear in mind we are a young, an honest
energetic, frank congregation & we I might add somewhat
tinctured of the moderate reforms of the age
& desire to select a minister compatible
with these views. With these ideas we
offered the Revd J K Gutheim this position
but circumstances well known to you
prevented his acceptance. He would
be a true model of what we desire to obtain

We write these facts & others as a committee
appointed for that purpose to correspond
with you & you may use such as in
your judgment, you deem proper for an
Editorial notice on the subject.

We are far removed from the seat
of similar applications with a lazy & uncertain communication between us &
necessarily must leave the matter in
the hands of some one who like yourself
well understands our want & can refer
us some excellent person—

We do not want an old man if
we can avoid it, for we conceive that
there will not be the Harmony existing as
between congregation & a young minister
of about 35 years of age, whose youth will
blend him to the errors of his young flock.

Should the minister please us
he will undoubtedly be elected for life
as soon as his first term expires, we
want an English Scholar by all
means, but one conversant with German
also will suit us better—

The people here are very liberal
& have contributed in a fortnight about
$20,000 to erect a brick synagogue on

a lot in one of our principal street
in size 65 ft x 1376 feet.

We have about two Hundred families
one half of whom belong to our synagogue
& many promising young men who will
do much to increase the community.
There are about 50 children & a number
of them who would attend school in the
basement of the proposed synagogue—

Our attendants are many at divine
service, considering our officiating Hazon
& we never have less than 25 or 30 present.

The building is to be a handsome
Gothic brick structure & to be paid for
fully out of our funds so that we may
have it unencumbered—

We have again of members to our
synagogue of about 33 per cent in the
last six months & now number about
100 contributing members.

A minister would be necessarily
exposed to heavy expenses & could not
possibly subsist upon less than $40
a week, were he to supply himself
amply with necessaries. Of course
he could curtail these expenses but
it would not suit the people to have
a penurious minister.

The perquisites are $10 for a marriage of
which he might reckon upon 2 a month
at least. For school children &c in
proportion & when teaching the Parassah &c.

Will you please inform us very
privately concerning the applicants as
to their abilities, qualifications characters
& should you wish your name kept
secret in the correspondence we shall
do so. Let us hear from you if you
desire any further information in the
subject & we will forthwith furnish it.

We will pay the expenses here
of any minister recommended by you
as fully competent & extremely praise
worthy, in case he should be elected
to the probationary term by the congregation
We have the Honor to be
Yrs Every Respy.
To the Reverend
